intro: Spiesia schmidtii, commonly known as the Schmidt's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a low, herbaceous shrub with slender stems and small, alternate leaves. Its flowers are clustered in cyathia, which are specialized structures characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family. Spiesia schmidtii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
